article.headline: UC Irvine 71, Pepperdine 63
article.story: MALIBU, Calif. -- Eric Wise had 15 points and seven rebounds as UC Irvine used a late scoring spurt to beat Pepperdine, 71-63 for its first victory of the season on Sunday afternoon. The two evenly matched teams traded turnovers and the lead for most of the game before Irvine snapped a 61-61 tie by out-scoring the Waves 10-2 in the final four minutes for the win. Michael Hunter had 14 points for Irvine (1-6), which was playing its fourth consecutive road game. Lorne Jackson tied a career-high with 17 points and Jonathan Dupre added 13 for Pepperdine (1-7) which has lost seven straight. Four players scored in double figures for Irvine and Kevin Bland had 11 points and 10 rebounds. Pepperdine led by as many as 11 points in the first half before Irvine made a mini-run that cut the Waves' advantage to 37-32 at the break.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
